# accessibilityLabel()

**Instance Method**

Returns a short description of the layout area.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityLabel() -> String
```

## Return Value

The description of the layout area.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityLabel] property.

Do not include the control’s type in the label (for example, use `Canvas`, not `Canvas Layout Area`). If possible use a single word. To help ensure that accessibility clients such as VoiceOver read the label with the correct intonation, start this label with a capital letter. Do not put a period at the end. Always localize the label.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityChildren()**: Returns the accessibility element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **accessibilityFocusedUIElement**: The child accessibility element with the current focus.
- **accessibilitySelectedChildren()**: Returns the layout area’s currently selected children.
